body_html:
Don't know if this covers any more ground, but I believe that the TensorFlow implementation of tf.strided_slice ignores the end index that is passed if shrink axis is true, because just naively adding 1 doesn't work for -1 case:

foo = [0,1,2]
foo[-1]  ==> 2

, where you'd get -1 + 1 = 0 which is the beginning and would be a degenerate interval.

I make a comment here to ignore it here
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/strided_slice_op.cc#L131

Special rules for shrinking are here (only stride 1 is allowed even though the op's parameter space allowed it, it couldn't generated with getitem):
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/strided_slice_op.cc#L280
And also
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/strided_slice_op.cc#L290

So it is documented in the comments, but it might be helpful to document in the spec and docstrings on both python and tflite side.

foo[-1]  ==> 2

, where you'd get -1 + 1 = 0 which is the beginning and would be a degenerate interval.
I make a comment here to ignore it here
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/strided_slice_op.cc#L131
Special rules for shrinking are here (only stride 1 is allowed even though the op's parameter space allowed it, it couldn't generated with getitem):
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/strided_slice_op.cc#L280
And also
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/strided_slice_op.cc#L290
So it is documented in the comments, but it might be helpful to document in the spec and docstrings on both python and tflite side.
body:
Don't know if this covers any more ground, but I believe that the TensorFlow implementation of tf.strided_slice ignores the end index that is passed if shrink axis is true, because just naively adding 1 doesn't work for -1 case:

```
foo = [0,1,2]
foo[-1]  ==> 2
```
, where you'd get -1 + 1 = 0 which is the beginning and would be a degenerate interval.

I make a comment here to ignore it here
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/strided_slice_op.cc#L131

Special rules for shrinking are here (only stride 1 is allowed even though the op's parameter space allowed it, it couldn't generated with getitem):
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/strided_slice_op.cc#L280
And also 
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/strided_slice_op.cc#L290

So it is documented in the comments, but it might be helpful to document in the spec and docstrings on both python and tflite side.
